I suceeded in making it working by increasing the initial 
temperature at 600K. But now I wold like to ignite at 300K.
How can I do this?
Thanks 
Solene



--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "se_deferrieres" <De_Ferieres-
S@u...> wrote:
> I simulated  hydrogen/air mixtures with Cantera scheme with  
> max_jacobian_age equal to [5,10]. Surprisingly when I decreased it 
> to [3,6], it takes much longer and with [1,1] it is not working at 
> all, and I had this error message: 
> 
> Procedure: OneDim::timeStep
> Error:   Time integration failed.
> 
> Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\ctmethods.dll
> Error in ==> 
> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\1d\@Stack\private\stack_methods.m
> On line 13  ==>   v = ctmethods(90, n, job, a, b);    
> 
> Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\1d\@Stack\solve.m
> On line 4  ==> stack_methods(s.stack_id, 104, loglevel, 
refine_grid);
> 
> Error in ==> 
C:\Cantera\research\premixedflame\miller\flameh2o2n2ar.m
> On line 91  ==> solve(fl, loglevel, refine_grid);
> 
> What is the cause of this problem? How can I solve this kind of 
> troubleshooting?
> 
> Thanks a lot
> 
> Solene
